subject: Using JUnit with IdeaJ in Broadvision
msgSnippet: Hi All, I am trying to use JUnit for testing some of our java classes that we are developing using Broadvision 7.1. We are using IntelliJ Idea 4.03 as our IDE
messageBody:
Hi All,
I am trying to use JUnit for testing some of our java classes
that we are developing using Broadvision 7.1. We are using IntelliJ
Idea 4.03 as our IDE and want to use it for testing.

I wrote a test class to call a Java Class and for some reason I
always get the following error

java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no BVUtil_native in java.library.path

BVUtil.class in my classpath(bvcore.jar) but I do not yet understand
how to configure my ide to use junit in Broadvision. I am able to
call the test class in shell script but I ideally want to use my IDE
to test.

If anyone had done some work prior to this, please let me know. Any
help is appreciated.

Thanks,
Subba

Here is the error that I get when I run in IDE
